title: Frank McAtamney
text:
Francis Steven McAtamney (born 15 May 1934) is a former New Zealand <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player. He was a member of the New Zealand national side, the <a href="All%20Blacks">All Blacks</a>, in 1956 and 1957, playing in the <a href="Prop%20%28rugby%20union%29">prop</a> position.
Early life.
McAtamney was born in <a href="Middlemarch%2C%20New%20Zealand">Middlemarch</a>, New Zealand, and educated at <a href="St.%20Kevin%27s%20College%2C%20Oamaru">St. Kevin's College, Oamaru</a> where he played rugby for the school.
Senior rugby.
McAtamney played for the Strath Taieri club and represented <a href="Otago%20Rugby%20Football%20Union">Otago</a> (in the playing position of <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%23Locks">lock</a>) from 1954 until 1957. He played for the South Island team in 1956 and was a New Zealand trialist in 1956 and 1957. He played in a New Zealand XV in 1955.
All Black.
McAtamney had played for Otago as a lock but he was selected for the All Blacks in 1956 as a prop. He played against the <a href="South%20Africa%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Springboks</a> in their <a href="1956%20South%20Africa%20rugby%20union%20tour%20of%20Australia%20and%20New%20Zealand">1956 tour</a> and he was selected again in 1957 for the <a href="1957%20New%20Zealand%20rugby%20union%20tour%20of%20Australia">tour of Australia that year</a>. In all he played eight matches for the All Blacks, including one international.
